Reviews.Content: Not true Sheraton experience This hotel had a good restaurant; hotel was clean and very basic. Hotel service was fair. Small hotel that didn't provide the experience of a Starwood property. Please stay elsewhere. This was more of a 2 star hotel.I stayed in Europe for 2 weeks and this was the worst hotel of the trip. Didn't meet expectations at all. Won't ever go back.
Reviews.Author: LovesEurope_8

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel! Nice hotel, beautiful and spacious room. Helpful and friendly hotel staff. More industrial and hotel area. No shopping within walking distance but walking distance to train station. Great place to stay if able to walk to train station. Very quiet area.
Reviews.Author: KLDUNAGAN

Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to shopping and transportation After some problems at another hotel, we booked this hotel through their Web site. Everything was perfect, from our arrival, to the accommodations, to the location, to the breakfast buffet, to our departure. The hotel is half a block from the S-bahn, next to a park and playground and shopping is within two blocks. The area is safe and easy to get to, just 15 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from downtown Frankfurt.The hotel staff were professional and very accommodating. They kept our luggage while we traveled to other parts of Germany and received parcels, which we were able to easily retrieve when we arrived. The breakfast buffet was first class. What else can I say...my family and I...we loved this hotel.
Reviews.Author: dangerpre

Reviews.Content: Great Stay One-night stay before returning home via Frankfurt Airport. Location is somewhat city environment. Relatively easy to find by car because detailed MapQuest map was accurate and traffic volume was low at the time. Easy to park at registration area in front of taxi stand. Underground parking garage easy to access (many auto doors and room key for security), but 16 鈧?and tight spaces. Location and exterior were not as impressive as web pictures. Interior was as nice as web pictures. Fourth floor room was ample and excellent, especially by German standards. It was quiet, appeared to be newly refurbished. Bed was very comfortable with quality linens. Bathroom was small, but quality. Front desk was extremely friendly, and helpful with information and directions. Had to leave before we could enjoy the provided breakfast, but staff volunteered to provided a box breakfast for us to take. It was very tasty and plentiful, although we had to finish the liquids before going through airport security. Local area in one direction takes you to the Elbe River for comfortable walking on paths along the river. In the opposite direction, you can walk to numerous shops, restaurants, and fast food. Easy drive to airport took about 20 minutes or so, and could gas up just before entering autobahn.
Reviews.Author: Marylanderkj

Reviews.Content: Excellent service and nice location Great breakfast spread! Shocking for Europe standards. Right next to a subway stop so it easy to get the airport (30 min max), downtown (15 min), and the main train station (20 min). Everyone was very nice and spoke excellent English. The room was huge by Europe standards, but average by American. There are restaurants right next to the hotel. Internet available in the lobby, but it is pricy. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: JaneDoe79

Reviews.Content: Nice Surprise Stayed here night of 01December2006. Front desk staff was very quick and efficient. Great size room and bathroom. Very comfortable bed, and nice hot shower. Both were welcome after long flight from Chicago. The bar area was really nice. Very popular and everyseat taken, but a second bartender was added and no one waited to order. Breakfast was excellent and a large selection. Best of all coffee was hot. Only negative had to get my own bags to my room. Other than that two thumbs up
Reviews.Author: ellfie

Reviews.Content: 15 minutes from airport Short, 15 min. taxi ride from airport. Also,convenient tram runs frequently right in front of hotel. This tram can take you into the Romer Square area of Frankfurt with historic buildings and cathedrals located near the more modern shopping district. AC was a welcomed relief on a hot, summer day, and breakfast buffet was one of the best I've experienced in Germany. Dinners were fair.
Reviews.Author: Rosewards

Reviews.Content: Very good hotel We stayed there during the World Cup. Its located south of the river and about 10 minutes from Frankfurt city center. Close by there is a shopping area with many restuarants. A five minute drive will take you in to the Sachenhausen(hope I got spelling correct) area where the night life is very good. The rooms are very modern and well maintained, however the winner was Juillard's bar. Very nice atmosphere to relax, and the bartender --- NINA is great. She will entertain with her skills in making cocktails. Be careful because if you drink her special shots, you will get very drunk!! Nina and other hotel staff were very friendly offerring advice on places of interest etc. --- Nina even made dinner arrangements for us at Bombay Gate one night. Just outside Juillards is a nice park where you can dine outside to take in the ambience of the park.This is a nice quiet hotel away from the hustle of the city center.
Reviews.Author: Trinivaltraveler

Reviews.Content: Excellent conference facilities. The hotel is a high standard three star about 30min (by taxi or train) from the airport. The rooms are clean and comfortable and there is a large shower (although no bath) Service throughout the hotel is good and the atmosphere is very relaxed. The hotels conference facilities are located in the old part of the hotel, the rooms are tastefully restored and very large. I would definitely recommend this hotel for training conferences/seminars.
Reviews.Author: EEYORETIGGERR

Reviews.Content: Brilliant modern hotel Very nice place for the business traveler in Frankfurt. Not far from the airport, yet a bit off the beaten path. Don't get me wrong, it's located on a busy street full of corporate offices and restaurants. But at least there's some street life outside its doors (try the Sheraton at the airport for a contrast here) and the possibility for a nice walk.Impeccable modern decor. My room was not especially remarkable, but clean and correct. The breakfast area in the lobby is quite interesting style-wise, and the staff are young but efficient.Give this place a try, you can most definitely do worse!
Reviews.Author: thielees

Reviews.Content: Great Business hotel ! We started a European tour at this hotel. The staff was very adept at all sorts of business functions - ie receiving faxs, printing E mails, drawing us maps, giving assorted info. The front desk staff multitasked to the hilt! Not the sheikest place, but a great place to start a working tour!ThanksJB
Reviews.Author: HotelGourmand

Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel This was a very nice clean and comfortable hotel. The staff, especially the front desk, was excellent, friendly and very attentive. I was also quite impressed with the restaurant and the wait staff. By the end of my stay, I felt as though I knew them well. My only complaint was that it was not easy to find Berliner Strasser the first time through and the staff recommended not roaming off the main street after dark suggesting to me that the neighborhood could be better.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
